key.name: levels
key.description: Number of blending LEVELS to use

key.name: auto-levels
key.description: Auto levels

key.name: advanced
key.description: Show advanced preferences or not

key.name: output
key.description: Output filename

key.name: tiff-compression
key.description: Tiff compression for output file

key.name: jpeg-compression
key.description: JPEG compression value

key.name: jpeg-compression-arith
key.description: JPEG arith compression value

key.name: jpeg-compression-boolean
key.description: Set active state of JPEG compression button

key.name: jpeg-compression-arith-boolean
key.description: Set active state of JPEG arith compression button

key.name: exposure-weight
key.description: Weight given to well-exposed pixels

key.name: saturation-weight
key.description: Weight given to highly-saturated pixels

key.name: contrast-weight
key.description: Weight given to pixels in high-contrast neighborhoods

key.name: entropy-weight
key.description: Weight given to pixels in high entropy neighborhoods

key.name: exposure-optimum
key.description: Optimum exposure value, usually the maximum of the weighting function

key.name: exposure-width
key.description: Characteristic width of the weighting function

key.name: soft-mask
key.description: Average over all masks

key.name: hard-mask
key.description: Force hard blend masks and no averaging on finest scale; this is especially useful for focus stacks with thin and high contrast features, but leads to increased noise

key.name: blend-colorspace
key.description: Force colorspqce for blending operations

key.name: depth
key.description: Set the number of bits per channel of the output image

key.name: wrap
key.description: Wrap around image boundary

key.name: associated-alpha-hack
key.description: Associated-alpha hack for Gimp (before version 2) and Cinepaint

key.name: size
key.description: Manually set the size of the output image; useful for cropped and shifted input TIFF images, such as those produced by Nona

key.name: position
key.description: Manually set the size of the output image; useful for cropped and shifted input TIFF images, such as those produced by Nona
